Inhaling the fresh breeze while enjoying homemade breakfast is a top-tier form of relaxation. Here in the blog, we have listed the 10 best picnic spots in Delhi. You can enjoy walking in nature, playing games, or simply relaxing on the green. Older people could breathe out some fresh air and do yoga as well. Get details about the top picnic spots in Delhi; read on. 1 Lodhi Garden Imagine strolling through a peaceful park filled with greenery, the gentle breeze, and the laughter of children playing. Lodhi Gardens is a place where history and nature come together to create a magical experience for families. Nearest Metro Station: Jor Bagh Metro Things to do: Walking, cycling, visiting the National Crafts Museum, playing in the park Nearby Shopping: Khan Market 2 Deer Park A serene oasis in the heart of Delhi, Deer Park is great for nature walks, birdwatching, and picnics. Picture yourself surrounded by greenery, the gentle chirping of birds, and the occasional glimpse of a graceful deer. Deer Park is a serene oasis where you can escape the city's noise and reconnect with nature. Nearest Metro Station: RK Puram Things to do: Walking, cycling, birdwatching, picnics Nearby Shopping: Hauz Khas Village 3 Buddha Garden Located in Raisen, Buddha Garden is a peaceful retreat with beautiful sculptures and lush greenery. Imagine a peaceful sanctuary filled with beautiful sculptures, the gentle breeze rustling through the trees, and the serene sound of a flowing stream. Buddha Garden is a place where you can find inner peace and tranquility. Nearest Metro Station: Udyog Bhawan Things to do: Walking, meditating, exploring the sculptures Nearby Shopping: Vasant Vihar Market 4 Garden of Five Senses Imagine a romantic escape where you can wander through themed gardens, admire beautiful art installations, and enjoy a picnic under the shade of a tree. Garden of Five Senses is a place where you can create unforgettable memories with your loved one. Nearest Metro Station: Saket Things to do: Exploring the themed gardens, admiring the art installations, enjoying a romantic picnic Nearby Shopping: Select Citywalk 5 Yamuna Biodiversity Park It's a sanctuary where you can connect with nature, escape the city's hustle and bustle, and create lasting memories with your loved ones. So pack a picnic basket, grab your friends or family, and embark on a peaceful adventure to this hidden gem in Delhi. Nearest Metro Station: GTB Nagar Things to do: Picnic, boating, enjoying the river views Nearby Shopping: Akshardham Complex 6 Aravalli Biodiversity Park A large urban park with a variety of ecosystems, perfect for exploring with friends. Filled with diverse ecosystems, the thrill of hiking or cycling through nature, and the joy of sharing laughter and adventures with your friends. Aravalli Biodiversity Park is a place where you can create lasting memories and bond with your loved ones. Nearest Metro Station: Guru Dronacharya Things to do: Hiking, trekking, cycling, picnics Nearby Shopping: Huda City Centre 7 Okhla Bird Sanctuary A birdwatcher's paradise, Okhla Bird Sanctuary also offers a peaceful and scenic environment for picnics with friends. Imagine a peaceful retreat where you can observe a variety of birds in their natural habitat, the gentle sounds of nature, and the tranquility of a serene environment. Okhla Bird Sanctuary is a place where you can escape the city's noise and connect with the natural world. Nearest Metro Station: Okhla Bird sancutary Things to do: Birdwatching, nature walks, picnics Nearby Shopping: Nehru Place 8 National Zoological Park A great option for school outings, the National Zoological Park offers a chance to see a variety of animals and learn about their habitats. National Zoological Park is a place where you can learn and have fun at the same time. Nearest Metro Station: Khan Market Things to do: Exploring the zoo, learning about animals, enjoying a picnic Nearby Shopping: Vasant Vihar Market 9 Nehru Park A spacious park with plenty of open space for outdoor activities, perfect for school picnics. Nehru Park is a place where you can let your imagination run wild and have a great time./ Nearest Metro Station: Lok Kalyan Marg Things to do: Playing games, sports, picnics Nearby Shopping: Nehru Place 10 Purana Qila A historic fort with beautiful gardens and a lake, perfect for couples seeking a romantic getaway. Purana Qila is a place where you can step back in time and create unforgettable memories with your loved one. Nearest Metro Station: Supreme Court Things to do: Exploring the fort, enjoying the gardens, picnicking by the lake Nearby Shopping: Chandni Chowk FAQs 1. What are the best picnic spots in Delhi for families with young children? Lodhi Gardens, Deer Park, and Buddha Garden are all excellent choices for families with young children. They offer ample green spaces, playgrounds, and activities that are suitable for kids of all ages. 2. Where can I find romantic picnic spots in Delhi? For a romantic picnic, consider visiting the Garden of Five Senses, Yamuna Riverfront, or Purana Qila. These spots offer beautiful scenery, peaceful ambiance, and unique experiences. 3. Are there any picnic spots near Delhi that are suitable for adventure seekers? If you're looking for adventure, Aravalli Biodiversity Park and Okhla Bird Sanctuary are great options. These parks offer hiking, trekking, birdwatching, and other outdoor activities. 4. What are the best picnic spots in Delhi for school outings? National Zoological Park, Nehru Park, and Lodhi Gardens are all popular choices for school outings. They offer educational experiences, outdoor activities, and ample space for picnics. 5. Are there any picnic spots in Delhi that are suitable for couples? Yes, there are several romantic picnic spots in Delhi. Consider visiting Lodhi Gardens, Deer Park, or Garden of Five Senses for a peaceful and intimate experience. 6. What are the best picnic spots in Delhi for a day trip? Most of the picnic spots mentioned in this blog are suitable for a day trip from Delhi. You can easily reach these locations by metro, bus, or car. 7. What should I bring with me on a picnic in Delhi? When going on a picnic in Delhi, it's important to bring a picnic basket with food and drinks, blankets or mats to sit on, sunscreen, insect repellent, and any other essentials you may need.
